result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle B Schmitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $25.00 per month commencing on 10-01-2022 and each month thereafter. Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with payment plan. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle B Schmitz

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Kyle B Schmitz
Current: 403 Summit Avenue, Oconomowoc, WI 53066 United States  (Effective: 08-05-2022)
Prior: Unknown,

08:34 AM Defendant Kyle B Schmitz in court with attorney J Andrew Herbers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Court conducts a plea colloquy with defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1. 

Court orders the following:	
Fine:  $316.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $25.00   per month, starting  10/1/22     and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  entry of civil judgment
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

dated 06-29-2022, filed by Atty. Herbers requesting to convert the status hearing on 08-05-2022 to a plea and sentencing hearing.

  **Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen on 06-30-2022: 8/5 can be converted to a Plea and Sentencing hearing.**
